Posted: April 13
Early Access Review
								Of my 70+ Vive games, this is my second favorite, next only to Smashbox Arena.  I have always loved flying games, especially gliding ones, but this one makes you feel like you're actually on the mountain!  The complaint of 2 of the 3 negative reviews was that the movement was controlled by the head.  This was changed months ago, and you now control it by moving your hands, just like on a real hang glider.  This is more natural, and lets you look around at the scenery.  Several of my friends and family and tried it, and they have all enjoyed it.The graphics are clean and polished, and it's well worth the $10.  I'll never forget the first time I stepped off the ramp at the top of Glider Island and dove down the mountain.  It was such a rush!Most or all of the other glider-like flying VR games are arcade style, and just move you at a constant speed. This one feels like the real thing.

Posted: September 4, 2016
Early Access Review
								I so wanted to love this game as I was a big fan of Pilot Wings on the N64!I suggested the developers should find and play it for inspiration, it was very similar (and to fix the controls as it was head movement only initially).It appears they did, or something similar, because the revised, updated game, which I played recently is so much better than the first release.The controls are really well implemented now with a choice of Xbox controller, head movements, or you can use the VIVE controls to fly it like a real hang glider.My only small complaint now is that I find it a little too hard to complete the levels, and with no way to access the other two island until you have completed the first level I found that I was extremely frustrated that I HAD to do the first one. I experienced a problem where my BOOST function on the XBox controller wouldnt kick in so it was impossible to do the first level, and so have not seen the others. I am sure this bug will be fixed soon, and I will have another go at it.The graphics and sound are great, there is a real feeling of flying a hang glider. Now they just need to add the other N64 Pilot Wings vehicles like the jetpack and microlight and I will be really happy.
